page.title: 06Council estates in Bookham
page.content: The district is well provided with council houses dating from 1929. The large{Grove}and{Middlemead}estates are post-war and there are smaller scattered groups of houses.{Edenside} provides flats, bungalows and shops for the elderly. The Mole Valley Council has followed Government policy on selling to tenants, and many have taken advantage. Many of the Grove houses have been sold and few young children live there now. Grove House, formerly Council flats, has been sold to developers who have built small units for sale. There is almost no property to let in the area and there is now a severe shortage of family_size council houses. The increasing prosperity of tenants is shown by the improvements they make to the houses and the cars parked in the roads.
